newsitem.title: USA: Finish Line says cost reductions help Q3.
newsitem.headline: Finish Line says cost reductions help Q3.

text.p: Finish Line Inc said Thursday reductions in costs helped the company post record sales and earnings in the third quarter ended November 30.
Finish Line said net sales totaled $73 million, up from $52.7 million one year ago. Net income rose to a record $2.6 million, versus $779,000 in 1995, the company said.
Alan Cohen, Finish Line chairman and chief executive officer, said the gains stem from reductions in selling, general and administrative costs as a percentage of net sales.
Finish Line is a specialty footwear and activewear retailer. Its stock was up 1/4 Thursday at 21-3/8.
